meanings.definition: A small jointed figure of a human being used as a drawing model.
meanings.sent1: In art class, we practiced drawing by using manikins as models.
meanings.sent2: The store displayed manikins wearing the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The manikins in the art studio sometimes seem to come to life when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with manikins, each one a silent observer of her daily life.
meanings.sent5: The manikins in the shop window looked so real, they almost startled me.

meanings.sent1: In fairy tales, you might encounter magical manikins who help the main characters.
meanings.sent2: The storybook described a kingdom where manikins lived in harmony with humans.
meanings.sent3: The manikins in the story were mischievous creatures, always causing trouble.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a manikin in the crowd, unnoticed and insignificant.
meanings.sent5: The manikin in the tale had a heart of gold, despite his small size.

meanings.definition: A model of the human body for teaching anatomy.
meanings.sent1: The medical students used manikins to practice surgical procedures.
meanings.sent2: The science lab had a collection of manikins to study the human body structure.
meanings.sent3: During the anatomy class, the manikins were the center of attention for the students.
meanings.sent4: The manikins in the classroom seemed almost lifelike, making learning anatomy more engaging.
meanings.sent5: The detailed manikin helped the students understand the complexity of the human body.
